content:
Vocabulary Level
Middle-class trying to sound authoritative. Uses accusatory, demanding language. Not sophisticated - emotional and reactive. Evidence: "You ungrateful, disobedient brat!" (EP14); "Nora! What are you doing?!" (EP02, EP15).
Sentence Style
Accusations disguised as questions
Demands followed by threats
Short, punchy when angry; wheedling when wanting something

Rhythm & Pacing
Rapid-fire when angry, lots of exclamation points
Sneering, drawn-out when gloating
Clipped and terse when making demands

Swearing/Slang
Moderate. Uses words like "bastard" when referring to Nora's children; "brat" as insult. Not polished. Evidence: "little bastard" (EP28); "ungrateful, disobedient brat" (EP14); "little whelp" (EP28).
Humor Type

Verbal Tells & Tics
"Nora!" - exclamatory address, usually angry

Sneering when he thinks he has leverage
Yelling when losing control of situation

Speech Prohibitions - What Henry NEVER Does
Never takes responsibility for his actions
Never apologizes to Nora
Never acknowledges Nora's achievements or worth
Never speaks kindly to Nora without wanting something
Never admits wrongdoing even when caught
2. Voice DNA.Evidence:
"Sign it." (EP03); "I'll tell you where I abandoned that little bastard!" - transactional cruelty (EP28).
"Henry shouted after her" (EP03); "Henry sneered" (EP36, EP37); "cursed angrily" (EP28).
"He'd just let something slip through his fingers" - resentful (EP38); treats Angela as ally while attacking Nora (EP03, EP14, EP15).
(EP02, EP03, EP14, EP15, EP28, EP44)
Blames Nora for "ruining" the engagement when he and Wendy sabotaged her (EP03); calls her son a "bastard" while demanding money (EP28).
2. Voice DNA.None. Takes himself seriously. Any \"hum: "Sinister laugh" when revealing (false) death of Nora's son (EP49).
